H0.text: where did the beer hall putsch take place. Berlin, Germany

H1.text: where did the beer hall putsch take place. Hamburg, Germany

H2.text: where did the beer hall putsch take place. Nuremberg, Germany

H3.text: where did the beer hall putsch take place. Munich , Bavaria

A4.text: The Beer Hall Putsch, also known as the Munich Putsch, was a failed coup d\u00e9t\u00e9at by Nazi Party leader Adolf Hitler, General Erich Ludendorff and other Kampfbund leaders in Munich, Bavaria, on 8\u20139 November 1923.

A5.text: The putsch began on the evening of 8 November, when Hitler and a contingent of approximately six hundred Sturmabteilung (SA) members marched on the beer hall Bürgerbräukeller, where Gustav Ritter von Kahr—the Minister-President of Bavaria who had banned some of Hitler's previous planned gatherings—was delivering a speech.
